intro: Crudia, commonly known as the false hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the Malvaceae family. It consists of several species, many of which are native to Africa and the Americas. The plants typically have showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to red. They are often shrubs or small trees with rough, hairy stems and lobed leaves. The fruits are capsule-like structures that contain small, hairy seeds.
